page.title: 02CRAFTS:ECONOMIC ESSENTIALS
page.content: There are two types of crafts people operating in Assynt. Those who practise their craft for a living and those to whom it is essential. Of the former, we have three businesses. One is a gemcutter who uses 10% of local stones to make his work, another is a local weaver who learnt her craft as an occupational therapy course (although there is a history of weaving in the area) & the third which is a siversmithing firm. All rely on the Tourist market, although the siversmiths are wholesalers. Knitting & Sewing is practised widely in our area and is equally essential because we have no drapery or proper clothes shops in Assynt. Some of the knitters sell any excess work to the visitors. The businesses are all one or two person ventures providing essential part-time employment during the summer
